mapper.sql: ID, CODE, NAME, DESCRIPTION, CREATED_AT, UPDATED_AT, IS_DELETED, KIND, POSITION
mapper.select:
select
from T_SES_BMS_DICTIONARY_DATA dd
ORDER BY dd.POSITION

select
from T_SES_BMS_DICTIONARY_DATA dd
ORDER BY dd.POSITION
mapper.delete: delete from T_SES_BMS_DICTIONARY_DATA dd where dd.ID = #{id,jdbcType=VARCHAR}
mapper.insert:
select sys_guid() from dual
insert into T_SES_BMS_DICTIONARY_DATA
ID,
CODE,
NAME,
DESCRIPTION,
CREATED_AT,
UPDATED_AT,
IS_DELETED,
KIND,
POSITION,
#{id,jdbcType=VARCHAR},
#{code,jdbcType=VARCHAR},
#{name,jdbcType=VARCHAR},
#{description,jdbcType=VARCHAR},
#{createdAt,jdbcType=TIMESTAMP},
#{updatedAt,jdbcType=TIMESTAMP},
#{isDeleted},
#{kind},
#{position},
mapper.update:
update T_SES_BMS_DICTIONARY_DATA
CODE = #{code,jdbcType=VARCHAR},
NAME = #{name,jdbcType=VARCHAR},
DESCRIPTION = #{description,jdbcType=VARCHAR},
CREATED_AT = #{createdAt,jdbcType=TIMESTAMP},
UPDATED_AT = #{updatedAt,jdbcType=TIMESTAMP},
IS_DELETED = #{isDeleted},
KIND = #{kind},
POSITION = #{position},
where ID = #{id,jdbcType=VARCHAR}
mapper.select:
select
from T_SES_BMS_DICTIONARY_DATA where IS_DELETED = 0 and ID = #{id,jdbcType=VARCHAR}

select
from T_SES_BMS_DICTIONARY_DATA where IS_DELETED = 0 and CODE = #{code,jdbcType=VARCHAR}

SELECT
FROM T_SES_BMS_DICTIONARY_DATA WHERE IS_DELETED = 0 AND KIND = #{kind} order by code

select * from T_SES_BMS_DICTIONARY_DATA where IS_DELETED = 0
AND POSITION <= (select POSITION from T_SES_BMS_DICTIONARY_DATA where IS_DELETED = 0 and CODE = #{lt,jdbcType=VARCHAR})
AND POSITION >= (select POSITION from T_SES_BMS_DICTIONARY_DATA where IS_DELETED = 0 and CODE = #{gt,jdbcType=VARCHAR})
order by POSITION ASC
